metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4435 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fwknop before 2.0.3 does not properly validate IP addresses, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (server crash) via a long IP address.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fwknop-apparmor-profile - 2.0.3-2ubuntu1
fwknop-client - 2.0.3-2ubuntu1
fwknop-server - 2.0.3-2ubuntu1
libfko-perl - 2.0.3-2ubuntu1
libfko-python - 2.0.3-2ubuntu1
libfko2 - 2.0.3-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fwknop package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3-2ubuntu1').
